abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column observes that rapid improvement by Ohio State quarterback Cardale Jones has come to symbolize championship team's transformation; notes that it was not long ago that Jones was an afterthought for the team, but was thrust into spotlight from backup slot only four games before the championship.
lead_paragraph: Ohio State’s Cardale Jones went from serving as a backup to winning a title in four games, but the greatest measure of his growth may be his new understanding of the game and his role in it.
snippet: Ohio State’s Cardale Jones went from serving as a backup to winning a title in four games, but the greatest measure of his growth may be his new understanding of the game and his role in it.

headline.main: Quarterback Is a Work in Progress, but Oh, What Progress
headline.seo: Ohio State’s Cardale Jones Learns Ability Is Pointless Without Maturity
headline.print_headline: Quarterback Is a Work in Progress, but Oh, What Progress
